short_summary: Sampling of Great Bear Lake ecosystem
description: The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada has a requirement to collect data and tissue samples of fish and invertebrates, and data on water quality. Data on water quality will address DFO’s mandate to provide advice to co-management partners on sustainable harvest of fish resources. Data and tissue samples for fish species, phytoplankton, and invertebrate samples from Dease / Smith / Keith Arm of Great Bear Lake.
duration_in_months: . Initially there was an issue with formatting that resulted in some carriage returns and new lines within the actual data. I amend this to better reflect the correct format.

full_summary:
### Great Bear Lake Ecosystem Sampling 2023

#### Notice Type: Advance Contract Award Notice

| **Category** | **Information** |
| --- | --- |
| Solicitation Number  | 30004379  |
| Contract Award Notice  | Yes  |
| Duration  | 5 months |
| Region  | Canada |
| Total Budget  | $X,XXX,XXX |

#### Terms of Reference

The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada requires a contractor to conduct ecosystem sampling at Great Bear Lake in 2023. The objective is to collect data and tissue samples from fish and invertebrates, as well as data on water quality.

Key tasks include:

* Environmental technicians will be stationed at Dease and Smith Arms to collect fish and invertebrate samples, as well as water quality data.
* Camp assistants will be stationed at Smith Arm to prepare dried fish for distribution to the Deline community.
* Local field assistants will be stationed at Keith Arm to collect data on water quality, zooplankton, and phytoplankton samples.
* Boat rental services will be required to transport personnel and equipment.

#### Constraints

* Contractors must ensure all necessary insurance is in place, including Workers Compensation.
* Contractors must report any issues promptly to the Project Authority.
* Boat operators must meet safety requirements as set out by Transport Canada.
* Contractors must obtain all necessary permits and licenses.

#### Requirements for Contractors

* Primary resource (crew lead) must have experience in leading projects on large northern lakes.
* Field workers must have experience working on remote field camps.
* All personnel must be certified in both English and the Sahtu language.
* Contractors must have their own bedding, tents, and firearms.

#### Project Timeline

The project is expected to begin on July 31, 2023, and end on November 1, 2023.

#### Contact Information

Inquiries regarding this procurement should be directed to [Jackie Longmire](mailto:DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca) at (506) 238-5870. URL: [canadabuys.canada.ca](http://canadabuys.canada.ca).

---
